kche_tree::has_trivial_equal< T > Struct Template Reference

Specify if a given type uses a non-trivial equality operator to enable optimizations. More...

#include <traits.h>

Detailed Description

template<typename T>
struct kche_tree::has_trivial_equal< T >

Specify if a given type uses a non-trivial equality operator to enable optimizations.

This template allows the use of optimized operations when possible. Any users of custom types that don't require non-trivial equality testing should specialize this to true. An example of this can be found in the custom_type.cpp example.

This mimics the structure of STL TR1 type traits, since no trait is provided for this information.

Note:
Any specialization setting the value to true should naturally evaluate std::tr1::is_pot<T>::value to true. This is currently not enforced since some compilers do not provide this information yet.
Template Parameters:
TType which information is being provided.
